title: Stargunner released as freeware
content:
3D Realms just released Stargunner as freeware. Get it at their site: [url=http://www.3drealms.com]www.3drealms.com[/url]Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Stargunner released as freeware
content:

Or then it (modding) would just get better.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Stargunner released as freeware
content:
Meanwhile deep in the dark caverns of Keen:Modding:

Andrew: So, the code will not be relased?

Xky: No.

Andrew: A pity. Nevermind, every day we become a bit more powerful, every day we uncover more of the code.

Xtraverse: Soon we will completely control Keen, source code or not.

Spleen: There remains only one question to ask...how did she get past the membership comittee?

LL: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] Muhahaha! Me make t3h 1337 cr4shing patchez! A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Stargunner released as freeware
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Now if only they'd do the smae for Keen. *wistful*[hr][/quote]

Sometime in the "not too distant future", Tom Hall lying idly in a hospital bed "fighting" for his life. John Romero visits him.

JOHN : Tom, if you could have one thing in this world in case you die, what would it be?
TOM : Keen Rights! COMMANDER KEEN RIGHTS!
JOHN : Anything except that.
TOM : Recreate Keen on [Next-gen Handheld console]?
JOHN : And that.
TOM : Release Keen 6 as freeware?
JOHN : Nope.
TOM : Rehire me?
JOHN : [Sighs] Hell no.
TOM : [Bursts into tears] THEN WHY DON'T YOU JUST KILL ME?!
JOHN : Say, I never thought of that. Okay, you'll have a cameo in our next DOOM game a la Doom II.
TOM : NNNNNNNOOOOOOOOO! [Dies][img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: Stargunner released as freeware
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

*A hospital bed where John Romero is fighting for his life*

JR: *Sigh* guys, I have a few things to confess.

ID: Of course, we're here for you.

JR: I embezeled money out of the petty cash account for a new car.

ID: We knew, you were worth it.

JR: In 1999 I ran over our rival Tim Sweeny outside Epic headquarters

ID: We know, we aprove of it.

JR: I've been giving out pirated Keenware and was going to give Tom the rights.

ID: We know, why do you think you're in here?A proud member of the signature stealing society

title: Re: Stargunner released as freeware
content:
If the source code did get release we could see ports of Keen on other consoles like PSP. Its been done with Quake and I think I heard of Doom also but not that sure. Think of it, a handheld Keen game that doesnt suck.The end is near. An evil force returns. And only Commander Keen can stop him, but this time he must team up with a super sonic hedgehog and a two tailed fox. Follow the adventure:[url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario/chaos.html]Dimension Chaos[/url]
A Commander Keen and Sonic The Hedgehog Crossover Fan Fiction

Visit my website at [url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario]www.geocities.com/superadammario[/url]

title: Stargunner
content: So how do you get this game to work?  It looks fun, but I have about a two second delay between hitting a button and having that action occur on screen.  It makes things quite tricky.

title: Re: Stargunner
content:
Are you running it in DOSbox? You'll need a speedy computer to do that. Mine can run it at a playable speed but just barely. I've got a 1Ghz CPU. To really run it well, I'd suggest a 2 or 3 Ghz CPU. You don't need an amazing and expensive computer, but you do need a new one. If you're playing it on an actual computer with DOS, it must be shockingly old.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/YorpEye.png[/img]

title: Re: Stargunner
content: Thanks!  I am running it in dosBox now with a 2.5 Ghz computer and while there are loading times and stuff, the gameplay works fine.  Pretty cool game actually, somewhat difficult too!*** ---   I Am Keen is hell bent for leather.  Are you?   --- ***
